facts.text: Ajmer Singh was tried for the murder of Bagher Singh

anchor.surface_text: Ajmer Singh, a young man of about 22 years of age was tried for the murder of Bagher Singh, his first companysin,

facts.text: Ajmer Singh acquitted by Sessions Judge of Ferozepore by judgment dated 13th May 1950

anchor.surface_text: and was acquitted by the Sessions Judge of Ferozepore by his judgment dated 13th May, 1950. On appeal by the State

facts.text: High Court set aside acquittal and convicted Ajmer Singh under section 304 IPC and sentenced to ten years rigorous imprisonment

anchor.surface_text: On appeal by the State Government, the order of acquittal was set aside by the High Court and the appellant was companyvicted

facts.text: Incident occurred on 28th January 1948

anchor.surface_text: It is alleged by the prosecution that on the evening of the 27th January, 1948, Jagir Kaur companyplained

facts.text: Jagir Kaur complained to her father-in-law that her husband Ajmer Singh had pawned her ear-rings for gambling debts on evening of 27th January 1948

anchor.surface_text: It is alleged by the prosecution that on the evening of the 27th January, 1948, Jagir Kaur companyplained to her fatherin-law that her husband had pawned her ear-rings in order to pay off his gambling debts.

facts.text: On morning of 28th January 1948 Banta Singh inquired from Ajmer Singh about ear-rings and Ajmer replied pawned to Banta Singh Mazhbi

anchor.surface_text: On the morning of the 28th Banta Singh inquired from Ajmer Singh about this matter and he replied that he had pawned the ear-rings to one Banta Singh Mazhbi.

facts.text: Ajmer Singh, Banta Singh and Teja Singh went to Banta Singh Mazhbi to get ear-rings returned but he denied and offered Rs 30 if oath taken

anchor.surface_text: Soon after this Ajmer Singh, Banta Singh and one Teja Singh went to Banta Singh Mazhbi and asked him to return the ear- rings but the latter replied that numberornaments had been pawned with him

facts.text: Lal Singh present at conversation and supported Banta Singh Mazhbi leading to hot words exchange

anchor.surface_text: and added that he would give a sum of Rs. 30 to them if Ajmer Singh took an oath that the ornaments had in fact been left with him. It is said that Lal Singh was also present

facts.text: At sunset 28th January 1948 Lal Singh and Sunder Singh abused each other from houses into common courtyard

anchor.surface_text: At about sunset the same day Lal Singh and his brother Sunder Singh started abusing each other from their respective houses which open out into a companymon.courtyard.

facts.text: Arjan Singh, Bagher Singh and Ujagar Singh Mazhbi came to Lal Singh's house on hearing abuse

anchor.surface_text: This wordy warfare between the two brothers attracted the attention of Arjan Singh, Bagher Singh and one Ujagar Singh Mazhbi who on bearing the numberse came to the house of Lal Singh.

facts.text: Lal Singh challenged Sunder Singh to come out in the open supported by three others

anchor.surface_text: Lal Singh finding himself supported by three others threw out a challenge to Sunder Singh and told him to companye out in the open.

facts.text: Sunder Singh, Banta Singh, Ajmer Singh and Teja Singh rushed out armed with spears

anchor.surface_text: It is said that Sunder Singh, his two, sons Banta Singh and Ajmer Singh, and Teja Singh, a companysin of theirs, accepted the challenge and rushed out of the house.

facts.text: Teja Singh and Banta Singh attacked Lal Singh and Dhan Kaur with spears inflicting injuries

anchor.surface_text: Teja Singh and Banta Singh were armed with spears and they made an attack on Lal Singh and Dhan Kaur and inflicted on their persons a number of injuries.

facts.text: Ajmer Singh armed with spear plunged weapon into chest of Bagher Singh who collapsed and died almost instantaneously

anchor.surface_text: Ajmer Singh, it is said, was armed with a spear and he plunged his weapon into the chest of Bagher Singh who companylapsed and died almost instantaneously.

facts.text: Arjan Singh reported incident at police station after 7 miles travel at 11-45 p.m. giving same version

anchor.surface_text: Arjan Singh soon after reported this incident at the police station after travelling a distance of about seven miles at 11-45 p. m. He gave to the police substantially the same version

facts.text: Police arrested Sunder Singh, Teja Singh and Banta Singh but not appellant Ajmer Singh

anchor.surface_text: The police arrested Sunder Singh, Teja Singh and Banta Singh but the appellant companyld number be found.

facts.text: Sunder Singh, Teja Singh and Banta Singh prosecuted under 302/34 IPC convicted under 324 IPC

anchor.surface_text: Sunder Singh, Teja Singh and Banta Singh were prosecuted under section 302/34 but were companyvicted under section 324, Indian Penal Code,

facts.text: Banta Singh and Teja Singh sentenced to two years RI, Sunder Singh to six months RI; on appeal Sunder acquitted, others reduced

anchor.surface_text: Banta Singh and Teja Singh were sentenced to two years rigorous imprisonment each and Sunder Singh to six months rigorous imprisonment. On appeal, Sunder Singh was acquitted and the sentences imposed on Banta Singh and Teja Singh were reduced.

facts.text: Ajmer Singh apprehended on 4th December 1948

anchor.surface_text: Ajmer Singh was apprehended on 4th December, 1948, and as above stated, was tried by the learned Sessions Judge

facts.text: Nikka Singh had three sons Bhagwan Singh, Lal Singh and Sunder Singh

anchor.surface_text: One Nikka Singh had three sons, Bhagwan Singh, Lal Singh and Sunder Singh. Bhagwan Singh died issueless some years ago

facts.text: Bhagwan Singh died issueless some years ago leading to property disputes between Lal Singh and Sunder Singh

anchor.surface_text: Bhagwan Singh died issueless some years ago and disputes arose between Lal Singh and his brother Sundar Singh in regard to the division of the property of Bhagwan Singh.

facts.text: Lal Singh is father of Bagher Singh (deceased) and Arjan Singh (PW 5)

anchor.surface_text: Lal Singh is married to Mst. Dhan Kaur and from her he had two sons. One of them Bagher Singh was murdered and the other, Arjan Singh, is P. W. 5.

facts.text: Ajmer Singh is son of Sunder Singh, brother Banta Singh

anchor.surface_text: Accused Ajmer Singh is the son of Sunder Singh and Banta Singh is his real brother.

facts.text: Sessions Judge held Ajmer Singh not present at Banta Singh Mazhbi's shop morning of 28th

anchor.surface_text: He held that Ajmer Singh was number present at Banta Singh Mazhbis shop and that Lal Singh and Arjan Singh had falsely implicated him in the quarrel over the ear-rings,

facts.text: Supreme Court appeal heard on 1952 December 10

anchor.surface_text: Gopal Singh for the respondent. 1952. December 10. The Judgment of the Court was delivered by MAHAJAN J.-
